history.content:
I had this same problem earlier, and SIS told me that if you drop either of the two classes, it will cancel the swap.

Unfortunately, they were wrong.  I dropped and re-enrolled in the class that I was not on the waitlist for, but then when I got off the waitlist for the other class, I got autodropped from the first.  It's possible that dropping the class you are waitlisted for will actually work, but I can't be certain (and even if the SIS people claimed that it would, it's entirely possible that that is broken too)

tl;dr: SIS claims that there is a way to cancel the swap, but it seems to be bugged.  You can try doing what they suggest, but be prepared to have the swap not successfully cancelled.
Please contact the SIS team. The Advisors in this department do not have control over your enrollment system.

children.subject: For future reference to anyone who reads, in response to the student response, this website https://sis.berkeley.edu/help/enrollment-faq/swap provides information about the above situation. Basically, according to the third case underneath Changes to Swaps, the swap between the two classes will still be active even though you drop the class you're enrolled in (and is involved in the swap) and then reenroll in that same class.

history.content: I have used the swapped feature to swap a class that I am currently registered in for a class that I am currently waitlisted, but, now, I want to keep both of those classes once I get off the certain waitlist. How do I opt out of the swap mode?
history.subject: How do I get out of swap mode?
